result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiannia M Hopkins

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tiannia M Hopkins in court.  Attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz in court for Tiannia M Hopkins.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. Based upon the defendant's compliance with the Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for Final Review Hearing in Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for February 14, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tiannia M Hopkins in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

As to counts 1, 2: Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review in Branch 17.  Review hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

defendant's apology letter, received and filed

Defendant Tiannia M Hopkins in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a DPA hearing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Tiannia M Hopkins in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court reminds defendant that the no contact order still remains in full effect. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TEG (d.o.b. 5/14/62).

Defendant Tiannia M Hopkins in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Tiannia M Hopkins in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tiannia M Hopkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
